lines.text: let color be a double array of booleans of size 120 and 120
let n and m be integers

lines.code: for ( int i = 0 ; i < n ; i ++ )
for ( int j = 0 ; j < m ; j ++ )

lines.text: set color [ i ] [ j ] and in to ' B '
let side be an integer and set its value to - 1
let first_row and last_row be integers and set their values to - 1

lines.code: for ( int i = 0 ; i < n ; i ++ )

lines.text: let row_start and row_end be integers and set their values to - 1

lines.code: for ( int j = 0 ; j < m ; j ++ )

lines.text: if color [ i ] [ j ] is equal to true and row_start is equal to - 1 , set row_start to j
lines.code: if ( color [ i ] [ j ] == true and row_start == - 1 ) { row_start = j ; }

lines.text: if color [ i ] [ j ] is equal to false and row_start is not equal to - 1
lines.code: if ( color [ i ] [ j ] == false and row_start != - 1 )

lines.text: if row_start is not equal to - 1 and row_end is equal to - 1 , set row_end to m - 1
lines.code: if ( row_start != - 1 and row_end == - 1 ) { row_end = m - 1 ; }

lines.text: if row_start is equal to - 1 and row_end is equal to - 1 , continue executing the next part of the loop
if first_row is equal to - 1 , set first_row to i

lines.code: cout << i + side / 2 + 1 << " " << row_start + side / 2 + 1 << endl ;
